Apollo Fuzzmoon

Puppet in cyberspace
TikTok Followers

@fuzzmoon

##3danimation ##puppet ##how

â™¬ original sound - Kira Kosarin

Apollo Fuzzmoon is a puppet who made the jump into the digital world, and has been warmly welcomed on TIkTok with over 20k followers.

Using off-the-shelf game technology, Apollo is rendered and performed in real time. Apollo is excited to explore the possibilities for online video, and is very excited to expand on the technology he is already using and break into the world of Augmented and Virtual Reality.

History

Apollo Fuzzmoon is a multimedia project by Elijah Atkins combining puppetry with 3D Animation. Initially designed for live theater in 2018. Apollo Fuzzmoon made his stage debut as "Stitch" in TDAs Help! Murder! Puppets!

Apollo has experience in black box and with green screen for live or video performances. And this year he entered into animation and digital puppetry.

Digitalization

In late 2020 Apollo made the plunge into 3d through photogrammetry. First hundreds of pictures from every conceivable angle were taken with a cell phone. Those images were processed with the AliceVision framework. 3D shape and texture data were extracted from those images. The rough generated model was then cleaned up, optimized and rigged for animation in blender.

Digitalization isn't always a difficult process, boxed food and products can easily be digitized with a few measurements and some prepared photos.

Into the Game Engine

Apollo started his Game Engine journey modestly with a simple endless runner, which you can experience here

After learning how to run and jump Apollo gained the ability to talk, turn his head, dance, turn into a rag doll and fall down.

Apollo can be operated with a PS4 controller, for real-time dynamic animation(perfect for live performances) or his animations can be pre-programed in Unityâ€™s Non-Linear Animator.

Realtime Rendering

Unityâ€™s HDRP delivers high quality renders in real time with current generation hardware. The HDRP uses physically based rendering. Many of the graphical calculations relating to light reflection and texture are precalculated. Once the calculations are done the information is baked into image files. Then the GPU can produce beautiful renders at the cost of a larger file size.

Using the same tools realtime rendering can be done in AR or VR!

TikTok and Beyond

@fuzzmoon

â™¬ original sound - Apollo Fuzzmoon

Apollo is currently using TikTok as a playground to experiment with a combination of traditional puppetry, computer animation, and machinima. Apollo Fuzzmoon has produced over 170 videos and gained over 20,000 organic followers with no marketing or outreach. And is continuing to grow.

Credits

None of this would have been possible without the availability of powerful graphics software, and the hard work everyone has put into them. Special individuals sharing their knowledge online with tutorials. And fellow artists who have made their tools available online to speed up tedious tasks (10 years ago it took me 2-4 hours to rig a simple character and now it can be done in 2-4 minutes!!!). And a special thanks to all the artists that make their models or game assets available. Here are links to everything that made Apollo Fuzzmoon possible.

Thank you

Elijah Atkins

Software
  • Photogrammetry software Meshroom
  • Automated retopology was done with Instant Meshes
  • Character Rig done with Auto Rig Pro
  • Additional Texturing done with Substance Painter
  • Animations done in Blender and Unity
  • Additional animations from Mixamo
  • Adobe CC by Adobe
  • Low-Poly 3d props and backgrounds by Synty
